        <educational>
          <learningResourceType>

          </learningResourceType>

            <source>LRE.intendedEndUserRoleValues</source>

          <typicalAgeRange>
            <string language="x-t-lre">17-17</string>
            <string language="en">17-17</string>
          </typicalAgeRange>
          <description>
            <string language="en">1) Introduction – Reminding of climatic conditions  which existed in a different geological ages in Poland 

2) Is the climate warming?- The comparison of diagrams of temperatures anomalies in Stratospheric, Tropospheric and Near-Surface (diagrams from Calibrate resource)
3) Explanation of phenomenon of the greenhouse effect (model from Calibrate resource: http://celebrate.ls.no/English/Animations/Science/drivhus_eng.swf )
a) The analysis of the graph showing concentration of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere 
b) The demonstration of  relations between changes of temperatures in Antarctica and the level of carbon dioxide and methan in the atmosphere
4) The consequences of the global growth of temperature:
a) growth of  the sea-level
b) melting of glacial
c) decrease of the annual mean precipitation (increase of deserts area)
5) Homework:
What economical consequences will Poland face as the result of an explicit increase of air temperature?

Attentions:
I use resources Calibrate at all stages. After this lesson student understands the relation between emission of the pollution and climate changes. The attractive graphics from resources Calibrate interest (I hope) student to follow information about this problem.

</string>
          </description>
        </educational>
